title: Set function
summary: In mathematics, especially measure theory, a set function is a function whose domain is a family of subsets of some given set and that (usually) takes its values in the extended real number line R ∪ { ± ∞ } , {\displaystyle \mathbb {R} \cup \{\pm \infty \},} which consists of the real numbers R {\displaystyle \mathbb {R} } and ± ∞ . {\displaystyle \pm \infty .}
